title: Inventory Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Iowa Health Care (Iowa City, IA) in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: The overall interview process felt natural. I was never uncomfortable answering their questions and the entire atmosphere was positive. The interviewers consisted of people in the current position and explained the daily workflow thoroughly.
Interview Questions: "What was the best thing that has happened to me this year?"

title: Revenue Cycle Management Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Iowa Health Care
Interview Descriptions: It was pretty easy. The first one was with her and then a panel with 3 others. It was intimidating at first, but it was a lot of situation questions and 2 questions in one. They make you have five references after the panel interview
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you were successsful

title: Eletronics Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Iowa Health Care in Sept 2022
Interview Descriptions: Started with phone interview with a hiring recruiter. They asked around 12+ questions. After that a 2nd call back and a few more job-related question on experience and education. Followed by in person interview.
Interview Questions: How would you solve a problem in this particular situation?

title: Nursing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Iowa Health Care (Iowa City, IA) in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions: I got an interview invitation not long after I applied online and had my interview over zoom. The interview process was very typical and generic. Initially I applied as a 50% NA but the manager was very nice and I was able to reduce it to hourly/on demand.
Interview Questions: "What are your strengths and weaknesses?" "What do you want to get out of this job?" "What kind of team player are you?"

title: Account Clerk Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Iowa Health Care
Interview Descriptions: Easy process. They are very nice and ask basic questions revolved around personality and past experiences. Mine was only one round so after the behavioral part you get offered. Overall, pretty easy so I wouldn’t stress too much
Interview Questions: Name a time you overcame conflict in the workplace

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Iowa Health Care
Interview Descriptions: Tour of the inpatient pharmacy operations followed by a 30 minute interview with pharmacy technician supervisors and a short math quiz. Overall  a relaxed process and took about 2 hours total.
Interview Questions: Describe  a time when you contributed to a team's success

title: Student Clerk Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Iowa Health Care
Interview Descriptions: Asked a series of personal/fit questions. Somewhere between 5-10 questions. The dress code was business casual and I heard make the next day that I got the job. The interview was super laid back and both supervisors were very understanding if you needed a second to think about the question.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you failed and how you overcame it.

title: Student Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Iowa Health Care (Coralville, IA) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: Super Easy, they make you feel comfortable and at ease. Be yourself and you'll do fine. The questions are your typical interview questions, nothing out of the ordinary. There are two parts, first phone, then in person.
Interview Questions: What would you do in a stressful situation?

title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Iowa Health Care
Interview Descriptions: super straight forward and the interviewers were nice, nothing too hard, just asked about experience and hypothetical situations. was super nervous for the interview but it was not too bad
Interview Questions: an example question: how would you handle a situation if a coworker was being difficult

title: Systems Administrator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Iowa Health Care
Interview Descriptions: Pretty easy. The online application was pretty long. Did an in person interview and heard back a couple weeks later with an offer. Overall, pretty easy, just kind of long.
Interview Questions: Tell me a bit about yourself?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Iowa Health Care (Iowa City, IA) in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: One interview with the manager and director. It was very easy and they focused on behavioral questions. Focus on how much you want to learn about your department and what you can learn from them.
Interview Questions: Do you have any administrative skills?

title: Nursing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Iowa Health Care
Interview Descriptions: A hiring manager set up an interview with my unit over the phone. The unit manager called me through the phone. Interview went well. An offer was extended that afternoon.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you had a disagreement with a coworker or patient.

title: Nursing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Iowa Health Care
Interview Descriptions: It was an in person interview, and they asked about 5 questions. There was a team of Nurses that are the managers that come in and listen to the interview.
Interview Questions: What would you do if you had conflict with a coworker?

title: Administrator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Iowa Health Care
Interview Descriptions: Very friendly and frank discussions, and I know this isn't always the case at this employer or at the University.  Went from discussing work tasks to my previous experience and education.  But less of the annoying behavioral interview questions (though again, this happens all the time at the hospital) and more getting to the fit at this place.
Interview Questions: One of the things was producing a document

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Iowa Health Care in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: My interview was short and concise. My interviewers were very polite and made it more of a conversation than an interview. They gave me time to ask questions, and followed up with me very quickly.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Iowa Health Care
Interview Descriptions: Great! Personable, good questions were asked. Gave me a good feel of what the job would entail, not a waste of time. Had a great time here, i would do it again!
Interview Questions: Why i wanted to work in healthcare

title: Identity and Access Management Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Iowa Health Care
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very easy and was not asked many questions. The process was very fast and there were no hard questions. It was very nice and comfortable. I would reccomend.
Interview Questions: What did you do to prepare for this interview?

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Iowa Health Care (Iowa City, IA) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: 30 minute screening call, followed by an in-person panel interview of about eight people ranging from colleagues to management. Interviewers followed a standard set of questions, each taking turns asking the questions from a printed list.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you had a conflict at work and how you handled it.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Iowa Health Care (Iowa City, IA) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: One on one with the nurse manager, some units include HR.  Depending on the manager they might be more intimidating than others.  Usually includes a unit tour.  They ask you about questions you have as well and give ample time without rushing you out.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself:

title: Student Computer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Iowa Health Care (Iowa City, IA) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: The professor asked me multiple informal questions regarding my past experience, school, and extracurriculars. I asked a lot of questions about the research. It was more of a conversation than anything. There was also a quiz on coding, but it was pretty basic.
Interview Questions: What are you studying? GPA?

title: Nursing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Iowa Health Care (Iowa City, IA) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: Had an in person interview, then a tour of the department, then after one to two weeks I got a call with the job offer. The entire process took about three to four weeks
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself 
What are your short term goals 
What are your long term goals

title: Student Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of Iowa Health Care
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was professional, yet inviting! I was interviewed with Tom, who was really easy to talk to. Even thought they had papers filled with questions in front of them that they were planning on asking me, everything flowed very well.
Interview Questions: When was a situation in where you had to take control when something went wrong?

title: Pharmacy Technician Trainee Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Iowa Health Care (Iowa City, IA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: A brief, 30 minute interview with two pharmacy technician supervisors. Questions were standard, covering past experience in health care, time management skills, prioritization, and conflict resolution. There were some personality-based questions and opportunities to ask questions as well.
Interview Questions: When did you face a disagreement with a coworker or boss/supervisor, and how did you resolve this?

title: Clinic Administrate Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Iowa Health Care (Iowa City, IA)
Interview Descriptions: Online application, was contacted about 4 months later to schedule an in person panel interview. I was disappointed at how slow the process was, but I also feel like it is standard for an entry level position at a large university.
Interview Questions:
How do you multitask or prioritize multiple project?
What is your experience with databases?
Describe a time you had a conflict with a colleague/supervisor/employee and how you handled it?
What kind of supervisor do you like to work with?
What work accomplishments are you most proud of?

title: Student Computer Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Iowa Health Care
Interview Descriptions: Very friendly. Questions were pretty generic personality and work ethic related questions. Interviewer gave plenty of time for questions and was very personalable about things outside of the work place, a receptive to any comments or questions.  The process only took about 30 minutes all together. I was offered a job on the spot.
Interview Questions: What past job responsibilities did you have and how would they translate to this job ?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Iowa Health Care (Iowa City, IA) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied through the University of Iowa Health Care portal that displayed postings for available positions at various labs. After a few email exchanges with the administrative assistant, I was asked to come in for an in-person interview. The on-site interview involved a short, 30-minute talk with the head of the lab, during which he asked about my background and my career goals.
Interview Questions: Describe a previous project you worked on as a Research Assistant.

title: Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Iowa Health Care (Iowa City, IA) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: I submitted an application online, received a phone call, and in about a week I had set up an in person interview. A background check and drug test were required prior to the interview. After the interview I heard back within a week and was offered the job.
Interview Questions: Give an example of a time you helped a friend in need.

title: Student Clerk (Nursing Department) Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Iowa Health Care
Interview Descriptions: I applied online with a resume. Nursing Recruitment got back in touch with me within a few days. I met with one of the Nursing Directors. Nursing Director was very nice and asked a few basic questions
Interview Questions:
What is your background in excel?
Are you comfortable completing various clerical duties

title: Nursing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Iowa Health Care
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed online through website. Was contacted by nursing recruiter via phone. Met with assistant nurse manager on unit and explanation of unit was given. Interview lasted about 30 minutes in total time, very quick but straight to the point.  Very easy and organized process.
Interview Questions: How do you handle conflict?

title: Registered Nurse, New Graduate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Iowa Health Care in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions:
I interviewed over the phone, got a call with a job offer, then they called the next day to tell me they called the wrong applicant and I did not actually get the job. The experience was rather unprofessional. 
The interviewer was very nice, but made it seem as though the applicant definitely had the job, and then they called to tell me I did the next day. Then, the day after that, they took the job away, so it was just very confusing.
Interview Questions: The usual

title: Registered Nurse, New Graduate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Iowa Health Care
Interview Descriptions: HR got back to me shortly after applying. Set up an interview right away for the next week. Interviewed with the nurse managers of the unit and had a 2 hour shadow of the unit with one of the nurses that was working. Interacted with other nurses, patients, and employees on the floor. Contacted the next day about moving on to the next step of submitting references.
Interview Questions:
Q: If we were to ask your coworkers about you, what would they say?
Q: Why should we hire you?
Q: Describe a time when you settled a dispute. How did you solve it?

title: Storekeeper Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Iowa Health Care (Iowa City, IA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very easy interview, walk around the hospital and show you what you are going to do in the units.  Once you are done walking around the hospital with the supervisor they go onto some onboarding questions.. very easy I would not stress over it.
Interview Questions: How flexible is your schedule

title: Student Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Iowa Health Care (Iowa City, IA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: I submitted my resume the HR and was contacted 2 weeks later for an in person interview and tour of the unit. One week after the interview I received a call with a position offer.
Interview Questions: What are your career goals and how is UIHC a part of that plan?

title: Social Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Iowa Health Care (Iowa City, IA) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: There was a brief turnaround in the time it took me to apply to be called for an interview. During the interview, you sit in front of the entire management team (5 people) which can be intimidating, but they are all very nice people. It took no more than an hour.
Interview Questions:
What is something you've done that you're proud of.
Describe a time when you worked with someone difficult and how you handled that.

title: IT Support Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Iowa Health Care (Iowa City, IA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with panel of five followed by a group in-person interview with panel of 7.  I was not asked in advance my salary expectations which ultimately lead to me not getting a offer.
Interview Questions: Was asked in advance to prepare a 10 minute training program for the position.

title: Revenue Cycle Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Iowa Health Care (Iowa City, IA) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview, followed by in-person interview.  The HR representative did not call at the time that had been scheduled so I called the HR department to inquire about the appointment time.  There had been a miscommunication between the scheduler and the HR representative.  A new time was scheduled.  The interviewer seemed distant and unengaged - robotic.
Interview Questions: How would you engage with callers regarding their University of Iowa Medical Center bills?

title: Student Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Iowa Health Care (Iowa City, IA) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: They contacted me within a week of submitting my resume and cover letter. I came in and sat down with 3 individuals. They asked the standard interview questions and it was rather easy.
Interview Questions: what are your strengths? what are your weaknesses? About former employment.

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at University of Iowa Health Care (Iowa City, IA) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was brought in and interviewed by 4 people.  I answered several questions and presented a project I had completed. The HR person reached out to me and told me I had the job pending my references feedback.  When that came back okay, they had to do a background check and then could give me an offer.
Interview Questions: How have you dealt with barriers to projects in the past?

title: Social Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Iowa Health Care
Interview Descriptions: After the interview process I was informed it was changed to a temporary position. The wait time for my interview was long. They seemed very unhappy to be there.
Interview Questions: What is your strengths?

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Iowa Health Care
Interview Descriptions: slow to respond. eager for interview. gives positive feedback and then never responds back about the results and when you call they say an internal candidate was selected for it
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Nursing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Iowa Health Care (Iowa City, IA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: very easy and relaxed, was hired a week later. It was just the manager and i, she asked me a few questions and it was more so a conversation.
Interview Questions: how would you approrach having an argument with a nurse?

title: Surgical Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Iowa Health Care (Iowa City, IA) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was quick and painless. They asked maybe 15 questions and it was over. I'm pretty sure they didn't check my references because they offered me a job 2 hours after my interview. Also, they don't drug test. At all.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at the University of Iowa?

title: RN Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at University of Iowa Health Care (Iowa City, IA) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: I had 2 interviews for 2 different units. Each separate interview was fairly similar. I met with the nurse manager and the assistant nurse manager, together, for the interviews. They were face to face, in their offices, and lasted roughly 40 mins each. I ended up selecting the second interview's job offer because the Nurse Manager on that particular unit had many years of experience and it seemed to be slightly more organized, as a unit, compared to the unit from my first interview. The Nurse Manager had more detailed responses to my questions and concerns and had extensive knowledge about the unit. She also emphasized team work and open communication with her employees. I truly enjoyed this job and was grateful I chose this unit. (internal medicine)
Interview Questions: What do I do outside of work to cope with stress?

title: Web Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Iowa Health Care (Iowa City, IA) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: I applied online through the university's student employment site, which lists part-time university jobs that are geared towards students. After I applied I got a request for an interview in the next couple days. The interview was probably the most relaxed I've been in an interview, the interviewers were all very nice and casual, even though it was a standard interview. I remember having to do a very small programming puzzle, but it wasn't anything super hard.
Interview Questions: Name one time you were stuck with a difficult programming problem and the process you used to solve it.

title: Student Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Iowa Health Care (Iowa City, IA) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: Sit down interview with an HR person and the department administrator. They asked a few questions to make sure I was competent (the job doesn't require much) and sent me on my way. They called me a few hours later and offered me the job.
Interview Questions: Simple questions, they didn't seem to be all that concerned.

title: For Summer 2014 Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Iowa Health Care in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: First send in an application,then you will be chosen for an interview, then there will be a 2:1 interview with other staff that takes 30-45 mins then, you will be called or emailed to let you know if you received the position or not
Interview Questions: the questions were not too difficult

title: Central Sterilization Technician (Student Position) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Iowa Health Care in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview was over the phone and mainly consisted of discussing my availability. They described the duties and responsibilities of the job very well, and also asked questions about my motivation for having and keeping a job. At the end of the interview I was told I was being sent forms to fill out for possible employment, including a background check.
Interview Questions: Does your availability match the times listed?

title: House Staff Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Iowa Health Care
Interview Descriptions: Standard process for initial interview (nationwide - match). Visit was cordial and people were enthusiastic about working here.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Applications Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Iowa Health Care (Iowa City, IA) in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: Typical interview with three managers or Directors. They asked standard questions like strengths and weaknesses; how did you handle difficult situations; etc. There were no tests or specific questions to assess technical skill level which I think should be standard.
Interview Questions: Give us example of a time when you had to deal with a difficult end user to solve a difficult issue.

title: Laboratory Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Iowa Health Care (Iowa City, IA)
Interview Descriptions: Little to no interview. Came in and assumed the position. This place is all about who you know. Find a friend who works there, come in, meet the manager, have a look around, and welcome to the team.
Interview Questions: Wasn't asked any questions

title: Student Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Iowa Health Care (Iowa City, IA) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: Heavily focused on the Disney Principles of Service. The interview process was tepid and easy. The manager was brand new at the time and placed a heavy preference on valid referrals
Interview Questions: What is your major and how does it relate to health care

title: Revenue Cycle Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Iowa Health Care in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: I sent in my resume 3 weeks out I received a call to set up a phone interview, it lasted about 15 minutes. 3 on 1. They explained what the position is like and then proceeded to ask regular questions like why do you want to work with us?
Interview Questions: The questions weren't hard but it is intimidating having 3 persons interviewing you. They asked, "Describe your typical day at work. What computer software's are you familiar with?

title: Administrative Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Iowa Health Care (Iowa City, IA) in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions: The process started with a phone interview with the current Administrative Fellows. We were taken out to dinner as a group by current Administrative Fellows the night before the interviews. The main interview day involved 5-6 one-to-one interviews with different staff members. The staff were courteous and professional, but asked pointed questions. The current Administrative Fellows escorted candidates between interviews to help navigate the large hospital campus.
Interview Questions: What is the one question that I didn't ask that I should have asked?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Iowa Health Care (Iowa City, IA) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: The interview process differs by which HR the department is going through. Some clinic hire through nursing HR which screens applicants before pushing them up the pipe to the nurse manager. Other clinics like to have more control and go through their own HR which speeds up the process depending on the HR rep.
Interview Questions: What type of people bug you? Tell me about your best/worst boss.

title: Research Assistant/Data Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Iowa Health Care in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: Pretty straight forward as far as interview processes go. They called and asked a few simple questions like greatest strengths, then called back for an interview, interview was scheduled and completed with usual questions, references were called, and offer was made.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: IT Support Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of Iowa Health Care (Iowa City, IA) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: The initial hiring process was communicated via email, as that was how I was informed of my interview. I then attended the interview which was a board style interview and was informed of my opportunity for employment a few days later via a phone call.
Interview Questions: Hypothetical questions of how would you handle certain situations given pressing and immediate circumstances

title: Student Programmer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Iowa Health Care (Iowa City, IA) in Sept 2010
Interview Descriptions: Had a group interview with manager and the other student programmers
Interview Questions: What would you change about the way I manage this business? - question from the manager

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Iowa Health Care (Iowa City, IA) in Aug 2008
Interview Descriptions: Met with professor and asked if he had any openings. He described his projects, and I described my experience. It was a good fit, and he offered me a job.
Interview Questions: Programming experience?
